What needs to happen to support this?
Instead of leaving this TODO here, can we either:

Add support for it
Or, throw an exception if a customer tries to use it?
Will be addressed in a separate PR to support custom group claims
getPayload can throw an CognitoParameterInvalidException.  Can we catch it and wrap it in an APIException?  You could throw the same one that is thrown for a JsonException below.
Can we catch a CognitoParameterInvalidException here as well?

The last few PRs for auth have gone right into the main body of this AWSApiPlugin. I'm worried about this. We should really be breaking the auth logic out into smaller classes.
Plugins, in a perfect world, are simply adapters between our business logic and the Amplify framework.
However, increasingly, this AWSApiPlugin is host to business logic.
@raphkim The model you used for your Predictions category -- where you had business logic services, and used the plugin as a thin-veneer into them -- was architecturally correct, for example.
to be addressed in a separate PR
